Superb Fairy-Wren by Andrew Haysom
“This is a female Superb Fairy-wren photographed in Woodlands Historic Park, Greenvale, in the northern suburbs of Melbourne, Australia. Woodlands Historic Park is rich in birdlife and is only a couple of kilometers from my home.”

title: Into the Woods by Svein Nordrum
text:
Into the Woods by Svein Nordrum
“This shot was taken while hiking in the Lillomarka wood, on the outskirts of Oslo in Norway. The dense fog in the woods this November day created a great mood for photographing!”

title: Dawn @ Tickenham IV by Gary Clark
text:
Dawn @ Tickenham IV by Gary Clark
“After missing so many beautiful misty dawn mornings this week while traveling to work, I decided to get up early and have a go at my first dawn shoot! This was taken on the moors in Tickenham, North Somerset.”

title: Puesta de sol con flamencos… by Francisco Cordero Fernandez
text:
Puesta de sol con flamencos… by Francisco Cordero Fernandez
“I took this picture of flamingoes during sunset on the farm of Veta la Palma, next to Doñana National Park in Spain.”

title: Polar Bear by Sue North
text:
Polar Bear by Sue North
“I took this shot just offshore from Svalbard, Norway, whilst circumnavigating the island in early August. I was one of 20 passengers; all wildlife enthusiasts. We saw 13 bears in all, as well as tonnes of other wildlife.”

title: Etang de Paimpont by David Martinelli
text:
Etang de Paimpont by David Martinelli
“This was taken in the North West of France, just before a storm. A few minutes after I took this, a large wave soaked me completely! But I still love taking photographs by the sea.”

title: In The Land Of The Dragons by Maria Kaimaki
text:
In The Land Of The Dragons by Maria Kaimaki
“Drakolimni (meaning Dragon Lake) is the name of several alpine lakes in northwestern Greece. According to local folktales the lakes used to be inhabited by dragons that fought each other by throwing pines and rocks, creating the peculiar landscape.”

title: Lina by Jens Franke
text:
Lina by Jens Franke
“During my photo shoot with Lina, I decided to try a couple of close-ups in the beautiful autumn sun. I was looking for something extraordinary, and tried different angles and expressions. In this moment, Lina’s hair perfectly complemented her expression.”

title: Richmond Park by Matthew Harris
text:
Richmond Park by Matthew Harris
“This was taken Richmond Park, Surrey. The day couldn’t have been more perfect. As the mist rose up and the sun peered through the trees, I spotted this stag in a perfect situation.”

title: NYC Skyline by Carl Larson
text:
NYC Skyline by Carl Larson
”The Lower Manhattan skyline taken about 30 minutes after sunset from the Brooklyn Bridge Park. This is a very popular spot among cityscape photographers, so I made certain to hit this location during my weekend in New York.“

title: Landmannalaugar by John Freeman
text:
Landmannalaugar by John Freeman
“I took this in the Landmannalaugar region of Iceland during a very wet cycling and photographic tour. With its spectacular colours, unique geological features and constantly-changing light, Landmannalaugar is a paradise for photographers.”

title: Letlive by Tom Joy
text:
Letlive by Tom Joy
“This is the fourth time I’ve photographed Letlive playing live, this time at Leeds Cockpit. Shooting this gig and then joining the crowd helped me to release negative energy that had built up, lifting my mood.”

title: English Springer Spaniel by Tanya Kozlovsky
text:
English Springer Spaniel by Tanya Kozlovsky
“I’m a pet photographer and this is a photo of one of my dogs. I live and work in Moscow, but my family and I love to travel, and we always take our two dogs with us. This shot was taken in Spain.”

title: Stormy Insight by Drew Hopper
text:
Stormy Insight by Drew Hopper
“I’ve had this spot in East Coast of New South Wales, Australia, in mind for a while, but never had the right conditions for a successful image. This time however, I was rewarded with the perfect conditions.”

title: Let Live by Iordanis Keramidas
text:
Let Live by Iordanis Keramidas
“The photo is a result of experiments using ND filters in order to achieve long exposure, so that moving the camera body may have a blurred and artistic result. It was taken on Xylokastro beach in Greece.”

title: Sparrowhawk by Nick Holland
text:
Sparrowhawk by Nick Holland
“This was taken at Alan McFadyen’s fantastic hide set-up near Dumfries. Following a 325 mile drive, I was in the hide from 7.20am. The female appeared regularly between 9.00am and midday, allowing me to take dozens of shots.”

title: By Ralph Matres
text:
By Ralph Matres
“Most people in rural Philippines rely on motorcycles to ferry residents to and from schools, work, and the market. Some plough the routes not served by larger vehicles and attach metal bars at the ends to accommodate extra passengers.”

title: Vigilant by Alfredo Sanchez
text:
Vigilant by Alfredo Sanchez
“This photo was taken in La Paz, Costa Rica. This red-eye leaf frog is an icon in Costa Rica. I used natural light and a white reflector to fill some of the shadows of the frog.”

title: Rocky September Sunset by Darran Dineen
text:
Rocky September Sunset by Darran Dineen
“The was taken in Guileen, East Cork, Ireland. The tide was out and the sunset was vivid, and I ended up taking this shot with the mossy rocks in the foreground.”

title: Getting There by Douglas Knisely
text:
Getting There by Douglas Knisely
“I took this shot on the north side of the Han River in Seoul, South Korea. I saw the beautiful details of this bridge in the fading light and waited for a good subject to come into the scene.”

title: Seal by Mike McKenzie
text:
Seal by Mike McKenzie 
“The shot was taken about one hour after sunrise when the grey seals were becoming active. Taken from a low point of view, I waited until the seal awoke and started to stretch.”

title: The Naked and Famous by Nan Palmero
text:
The Naked and Famous by Nan Palmero
“This is Thom Powers from The Naked and Famous, a band from New Zealand. I shot there as a Samsung Imagelogger, where we are provided their newest cameras to use pre-launch.”

title: Downton Vancouver by Xavier Wiechers
text:
Downton Vancouver by Xavier Wiechers 
“I took three exposures of this scene and post processed the image to HDR. In the final shot, the traffic in the foreground was too distracting, so I did a motion blur effect in Photoshop.”

title: Julie by Dvix
text:
Julie by Dvix
“This photo was taken during a fairly intense storm that had blown the power out in the cabin we were in. About an hour after this photo was taken, the cabin was actually torn apart by a fallen tree!”

title: Costa Occidental by José María Franco López
text:
Costa Occidental by José María Franco López
“This was taken in Cabo Busto, Asturias, Northern Spain. I wanted to take a shot of the wind and clouds with a very long exposure. This was the result.”

title: Wind by Tobias Schenk
text:
Wind by Tobias Schenk
“This was taken in a Prague metro station. My friend and I were on a sightseeing trip, but the rain was constant. So we decided to take some indoor shots to stay dry, and captured this shot in the underground.”

title: Divine Morning II by Zaw Wai
text:
Divine Morning II by Zaw Wai
“This was a magical and divine morning, as the gentle rays of morning light revealed the silhouette of the ancient Buddhist Temple of Borobudur, Indonesia.”

title: By Gioacchino Petronicce
text:
By Gioacchino Petronicce
“This photography was shot during summer in Hossegor, France. There was a man who was enjoying the challenging waves. I wanted shoot this man against the wall of water to represent loneliness.”

title: Champignons du soir… by Valérie Badan
text:
Champignons du soir… by Valérie Badan
“A friend of mine invited my to ‘mushroom photo session’.  We went to a wood near where we live in Switzerland, by Lake Geneva. It was the end of the day, giving some nice lights and colors.”

title: Friendship in Tofino by Tara Romasanta
text:
Friendship in Tofino by Tara Romasanta
“This was taken in Tofino, Canada, during a trip with my photographer friends. I couldn’t resist the silhouettes of these two on the rocks at Chesterman beach, asked them to hold hands.”

title: Richmond Park Deer by Raphaël Jourdan
text:
Richmond Park Deer by Raphaël Jourdan
“I’d been watching this deer for several days. I took this in the morning when there was a lot of fog, giving this shot a particular atmosphere.”

title: By Jesus Mendez
text:
By Jesus Mendez
“This was taken in Crevillente, Alicante, Spain. It shows an 18th century aqueduct called Els Pontets (The Bridges), which was restored recently.”

title: Tall & Proud by Diane Lassaline
text:
Tall & Proud by Diane Lassaline
“I am addicted to dandelions so am always on the lookout for these little miracles popping up in my own yard. I love close-ups and rarely change my lens for anything else.”

title: Amanece que no es poco by Rubén Toquero
text:
Amanece que no es poco by Rubén Toquero
“This picture is taken in Costanova, Portugal, during sunset. We were walking along the sea shore, and as we saw the red light in the sky we came to the boardwalk to capture silhouette shots.”

title: Katmai Bears by Richard McManus
text:
Katmai Bears by Richard McManus
“These two bears were fighting over a dead moose in Katmai National Park, Alaska. They were like boxers and would have a rest every few minutes. The whole thing lasted over an hour. The bear on the left was defeated.”

title: Midi á Midi B/N by Cruz Vicente
text:
Midi á Midi B/N by Cruz Vicente
“The photograph shows the Midi D'Ossau peak – one of the most beautiful in the Pyrenees. It was at noon, but a leaden skies filtered the light. I thought that it was a good moment to take a picture.”

title: Egypt by Sébastien Mamy
text:
Egypt by Sébastien Mamy
“This morning on the Nile, the conditions were perfect for taking pictures. I was waiting for sunrise I saw a king fisher flying along the surface of the river. The soft colours and the blurred reflection made the shot.”

title: Speed Night by Marta Errea
text:
Speed Night by Marta Errea
“This was taken on Gran Vía street, Madrid. I wanted to express the bustle of a big city centre at night. I used a tripod, a remote trigger and off-camera flash.”

title: White Pocket Lightning by Andrew Waddington
text:
White Pocket Lightning by Andrew Waddington
“This is the lesser-known White Pockets at Arizona’s Vermillion Cliffs – you need a powerful 4WD to reach here. I shot this as a summer monsoon passed through late in the afternoon.”

title: Pushing On by Stephen Boote
text:
Pushing On by Stephen Boote
“The shot was taken on the Great Gable in the Lake District, England. A low cloud had ruined most of the day, so I was fortunate to grab this interlude before it came rolling back in again.”

title: Early Forest by David Baker
text:
Early Forest by David Baker
“This was taken at Puckpits in the New Forest, Hampshire, UK, a little after dawn. It’s part of a photographic project called ‘Ridge Trees’ which explores a small area of the forest at dawn and in misty conditions.”

title: The Mosque (Reflections) by Achim Thomae
text:
The Mosque (Reflections) by Achim Thomae
“The image was taken during my trip to Abu Dhabi. A highlight of this trip was the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque. I spent a lot of time within this architectural masterpiece with wonderful light and symmetries.”

title: Polar Bear and Me by Peter Meijer
text:
Polar Bear and Me by Peter Meijer
“This was taken at Blijdorp Zoo in Rotterdam, Netherlands. This little girl was watching a bear playing with an object, and something in the look of the girl struck me.”

title: Morteratsch by Sandro Zanetti
text:
Morteratsch by Sandro Zanetti
“The picture was taken in the Morteratsch Glacier, Switzerland, right before sunrise. In the background you see the glacier and the Bernina area, with the highest mountain in the region of Graubünden.”

title: Passion by Sonia Masarova
text:
Passion by Sonia Masarova
“I took this photo at my local beach at Cronulla, south of Sydney, at the end of a very stormy day, which produced an incredible sunset.”

title: Kimi by Brendan Gara
text:
Kimi by Brendan Gara
“I shot this portrait in a studio, lighting the model with a shoot-through umbrella to the right at head height, and a 60cm gridded beauty dish in front and above. Shooting at 90mm is always very flattering.”

title: The Hunt for the Red October by Kevin Evans-Jones
text:
The Hunt for the Red October by Kevin Evans-Jones
“This was taken on the North Yorkshire moors. I attached my camera to a tripod, put out some nuts, and waited. Within minutes the squirrels made an appearance and were soon feeding even from our hands.”

title: Bison in the mist by Sébastien Mamy
text:
Bison in the mist by Sébastien Mamy
“Early in the morning, bisons of Yellowstone National Park gather in large herds. Benefiting from the morning myst to create a dramatic atmosphere, I was looking for bisons crossing the river. This male arrived and crossed the water. A perfect moment.”

title: Stargazing with the Moai by Ben Leshchinsky
text:
Stargazing with the Moai by Ben Leshchinsky
“The true magic of the Easter Island Moai come to life after the sun has set. This moment was incredible, giving us a glimpse into what it may have been like hundreds of years ago when these monuments were constructed.”

title: ISSUE 58 OF PHOTOGRAPHY WEEK IS OUT NOW FOR iPAD AND iPHONE!
text:
ISSUE 58 OF PHOTOGRAPHY WEEK IS OUT NOW FOR iPAD AND iPHONE!
Take out a risk-free trial subscription and get your first five issues FREE at http://goo.gl/BBkmxR.

title: Hvalsneskirkja by Asmundur Þorkelsson
text:
Hvalsneskirkja by Asmundur Þorkelsson
“This is Starneskirkja, a church near Sandgerði, Iceland built in 1886. This is composed of two exposures, which I combined in Photoshop, where I also adjusted curves, levels, and selective colours.”

title: Danielle by Brian Rickey
text:
Danielle by Brian Rickey
“As the sun was setting over a grassy hill, I told Danielle to walk toward her horse. It was the movement of her hands gently over the grass as she walked towards her beautiful horse that caught my attention here.”

title: To Surf, or Not to Surf, That is the Question by Rob Kints
text:
To Surf, or Not to Surf, That is the Question by Rob Kints
“This was shot on South Beach, The Hague. I wanted to shoot silhouettes of surfers against the sun, but the waves weren’t good. When I was about to go, this surfer came onto the scene, and I took this shot.”

title: Pine Siskin by Matt Bango
text:
Pine Siskin by Matt Bango
“The Pine Siskin is a rare winter visitor to New Jersey. I happened to find a flock of them feeding at Liberty State Park, just across the Hudson river from Manhattan.”

title: Golden Coins by Rhonda Martin
text:
Golden Coins by Rhonda Martin
“I set the camera on the tripod with the lens facing down at a 45% angle to the ground. After pressing the shutter, I gently lifted the bottom of the camera up to get the vertical blur.”

title: Ronik by Ivan Dostál
text:
Ronik by Ivan Dostál
“This was taken on my first day with a new camera. I took this photograph of my friend’s dog to create a wallpaper for his desktop. I chose a plain background and used a shallow depth of field.”

title: Light and Isolation at Middle Velma Lakes, Desolation Wilderness by Christian Arballo
text:
Light and Isolation at Middle Velma Lakes, Desolation Wilderness by Christian Arballo
“I took this above Emerald Bay at Lake Tahoe, California. The spot we found was absolutely perfect and the view was stunning. Middle Velma has micro islands and is a perfect spot to backpack.”

title: Zest by Sharon Stevens
text:
Zest by Sharon Stevens
“This image of Zest – my best friend’s dressage horse. Having first slowly introduced the flashes and softbox to him, he seemed quite unphased and happily stood posing for us.”

title: Ridge Trail Sunrise by Marc Crumpler
text:
Ridge Trail Sunrise by Marc Crumpler
“Taken at Black Diamond Mines Regional Preserve in Antioch, California.There was smoke drifting overhead from a fire burning on Mt. Diablo, so I travelled to this location to photograph this scene while the sun was low on the horizon.”

title: Dead End Cliff by Tommy Johansen
text:
Dead End Cliff by Tommy Johansen
“This was taken at Nesland in the Lofoten Islands, Norway. The weather had been grey for days, and the light was flat, so I used an ND filter and a long exposure.”

title: Moving Rock by Rawin Cheasagul
text:
Moving Rock by Rawin Cheasagul
“Racetrack Playa is one of the famous places in Death Valley National Park. To capture the moving rocks and their trails, light from the sunrise was needed to create long shadows and increase the details of the trails.”

title: Haukadalur í Dýrafirði by Bernhardur Gudmundsson
text:
Haukadalur í Dýrafirði by Bernhardur Gudmundsson
“This photo was captured in Westfjords, Iceland after a harsh winter storm with heavy snowfall in the mountains. There was a moment of serenity as the sun came up, which was wonderful for animals and humans alike.”

title: Stars Whirlpool by Rawin Cheasagul
text:
Stars Whirlpool by Rawin Cheasagul
“This was taken in Yosemite National Park, showing the Upper and Lower Yosemite Falls. I used a very long exposure, and bright moonlight to capture both star trails and the dead tree in the foreground.”

title: Floating II by Emiliano Iko
text:
Floating II by Emiliano Iko
“This was taken in the sea of Croatia while swimming with a friend of mine one cloudy morning. The underwater Nikon Coolpix camera had water on the lens, causing the blur at the edges.”

title: Morning in the Mountains by Gabriel Marian
text:
Morning in the Mountains by Gabriel Marian
“I took this in June in Vama village in Romania. I was traveling with a friend to catch the sunrise in the mountains. On the way, we stopped the village at about 3.30am to capture the atmosphere of the moment.”

title: Bare Mountain by Andreas Christensen
text:
Bare Mountain by Andreas Christensen
“This was from a mountain hike to Kjerag, at Lysefjorden in Norway. The highest point is 1,110 metres above sea level. Being so close to the clouds creates a great show play on the mountain tops.”

title: Common Blue Butterfly by Martyn Hall
text:
Common Blue Butterfly by Martyn Hall
“I found a small colony of the Common Blue butterfly on a walk alongside the Huntspill River in Somerset, UK. As long as you don’t move to suddenly, they are more than happy to pose for the camera.”

title: Alvida Juma Twighlight at Jama Masjid by Nimit Nigam
text:
Alvida Juma Twighlight at Jama Masjid by Nimit Nigam
“Alvida Juma is the last Friday of the holy month of Ramadan. Muslims here are gathered around Jama Masjid mosque in New Delhi, India.”

title: Red Fox by John Crawford
text:
Red Fox by John Crawford
“This red fox visits our garden most nights.I’d put some scraps of food out and sat in my hide, waiting for her to come. I was able to capture her yawning as she settled down for a snooze.”

title: Hana by Akimasa Harada
text:
Hana by Akimasa Harada
“This is Hana, a member of my Cat Cafe ‘Miaw’ in Japan. Her jumping is incredible, and I’m best able to capture it using manual focus.”

title: Kilchurn Castle, Scotland by Trevor Cotton
text:
Kilchurn Castle, Scotland by Trevor Cotton
“The day began with poor visibility and rain. I crossed a bog to reach this view point, and with one hand holding an umbrella chose a long exposure to add softness to the low cloud shrouding the mountains.”

title: By Tim Wu
text:
By Tim Wu
“This picture – taken in northern Tainan, Taiwan – is from a series of female portraits called ‘Scent’. In the series, it’s my goal to capture and represent beauty and emotions.”

title: The Glacier (Purple) by Achim Thomae
text:
The Glacier (Purple) by Achim Thomae
“This was taken during a weekend trip to the Weisssee-Glacier in Austria. The High Tauern National Park is a fascinating place – a spectacular, colourful alpine landscape with a lot of photo opportunities.”

title: Through the Reeds by Adrian Campfield
text:
Through the Reeds by Adrian Campfield
“This is my local river – the Darenth – that runs through the Crayford marshes in Bexley, Kent, England. There are always birds that use the river such as this grey heron, hunting the rivers edge for fish.”

title: The Corpse by Eve North
text:
The Corpse by Eve North
“I took this in the grounds of an old country home in Ireland. We were out for hours and I didn’t capture anything I fell in love with, but just as we were about to head home, I snapped this.”

title: By Joe Eisner
text:
By Joe Eisner 
“This is a photo of a young skateboarder taken at Venice Beach, LA. This a popular tourist and photography site and many people come to check out the skateboarders, especially during the summer months.”

title: Fatima by Jontxu Fernandez
text:
Fatima by Jontxu Fernandez
“This photo was taken in the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima, in Portugal. The light was perfect when a I saw a sister upstairs and other group of sisters downstairs, and I felt that it was the right moment.”

title: Setting Moon by David Briard
text:
Setting Moon by David Briard 
“I came to the beach early in the morning to photograph the sunset, but when I saw that the sea was completely calm, with the full moon hanging on the horizon, I felt very lucky to be able to capture this scene.”

title: El paso by Maria
text:
El paso by Maria
“The photo was taken from a twelve floor terrace in Torrenueva in Granada, Spain. I liked the road markings and thought it would look great if someone walked into frame, so I simply waited for someone to cross.”

title: Little Owl (Athene Noctua) by Phil Winter
text:
Little Owl (Athene Noctua) by Phil Winter
“I used five flash guns set to 1/16th power to give me plenty of speed to freeze the bird in the air. I got three frames in focus thanks, to the small aperture and wide angle lens.”

title: Mossy Middle by Ray Jennings
text:
Mossy Middle by Ray Jennings
“Merimbula is a small town located in New South Wales, Australia. The town boasts five main beaches, which offer some wonderful opportunities for seascape photography, but by far the best is Middle beach, pictured here.”

title: Brighton Pavilion at Sunset by Kevin Meredith
text:
Brighton Pavilion at Sunset by Kevin Meredith
“This is the Royal Pavilion in Brighton, UK. When the sky turned this colour I had to take a few shots. I underexposed the picture by half a stop to make the blacks really black.”

title: Racquet Tailed Roller by Doris Rapp
text:
Racquet Tailed Roller by Doris Rapp
“This colorful racquet-tailed roller is one of the native African birds featured in the aviary of the Expedition Congo: African Forest section of the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium located in Columbus, Ohio.”

title: Waves by John Harrison
text:
Waves by John Harrison
“I took this picture through a window in the John Hancock Building in Chicago. From here, sometimes I’m above the clouds, sometimes in the clouds, and sometimes below them.”

title: Fencepost at Sunset by Michael James
text:
Fencepost at Sunset by Michael James
“This was taken east of Camrose in Alberta, Canada as part of a timelapse sequence. I often go through the sequences I shoot to see if there are any images that can be taken out and used on their own.”

title: Mr. Blue Jeans by Hali Sowle
text:
Mr. Blue Jeans by Hali Sowle
“This photo of a strawberry poison dart frog was taken in Costa Rica during a photography workshop. We were lucky enough to find quite a few of these tiny amphibians on the grounds of our lodging.”

title: Mirrored Mural Moment by David Ingraham
text:
Mirrored Mural Moment by David Ingraham
“This mural in LA is by Robert Vargas. I wanted to do more than just take a snapshot. After stepping into the street and seeing the reflection in a parked car, I waited for someone to walk into the scene.”

title: Reflection by Rungkit Charoenwat
text:
Reflection by Rungkit Charoenwat
“This is the Black Dragon Pool in Lijiang city, in Yunnan province. I shot with the camera low to the water, using an ND filter to get a clear reflection of Jade Dragon Snow mountain.”

title: Dahlia Close Up by Charles Bonham
text:
Dahlia Close Up by Charles Bonham
“This is a photo of a dahlia flower taken at a local community garden called Dahlia Hill in Midland, Michigan, USA. I wanted to try out my new Olympus 60mm macro lens on the dahlias in full bloom.”

title: Mount Shimen by Pan Chung
text:
Mount Shimen by Pan Chung
“I really like to shoot stars against natural landscapes. This photo shows Mount Shimen, part of the Hehuan Hills in Taiwan. This was my third time shooting here, at a height of over 3000 meters.”

title: The Storm is Coming by Jirawas Teekayu
text:
The Storm is Coming by Jirawas Teekayu
“This picture was taken from one of the high-rise buildings in Bangkok. A storm was on its way and I could see that the rain had already fallen on the other side of the city.”

title: Fisherman vs Cat by Julien Ballet-Baz
text:
Fisherman vs Cat by Julien Ballet-Baz
“Istanbul is actually a city of water, and a city of cats. I was enjoying time watching the fishermen when I saw a few cats waiting to steal fish, and I knew I could get an interesting shot of this!”

title: Snow by Eve North
text:
Snow by Eve North
“This is a portrait of a girl that I met at an exhibition. She captivated me from across the room and we became fast friends. This was taken at a nature reserve near to where I live in Ireland.”

title: Dusk over the North west Fells by Terry Roberts
text:
Dusk over the North west Fells by Terry Roberts
“This was taken from the top of Red Pike in the northwest of the English Lake District, showing the lakes of Crummock Water on the left and Buttermere on the right.”

title: A beautiful clear sky…nothing but stars! by Catherine Hammer
text:
A beautiful clear sky…nothing but stars! by Catherine Hammer
“This was created using 11 images and merging them together to create star trails. I had varying degrees of light painting on the tree in four of the images.”

title: L'escargot by Scott Baldcock
text:
L'escargot by Scott Baldcock
“This is a shot of the Heals Store staircase in Tottenham Court Road, London. I processed this in Lightroom 4 for a colour version and then in made a black and white version in Silver Efex Pro 2.”

title: Shores of Île d'Orléans by Carol Persons
text:
Shores of Île d'Orléans by Carol Persons
“This is a self-portrait taken in Quebec City on the Shores of Île d'Orléans. While driving around the island I spotted this washed up boat and had to shoot with it.”

title: Camouflage by Mo
text:
Camouflage by Mo
“This was taken in Chefchaouen, a village in Morocco. I noticed this man sitting here, and was struck by how perfectly the colours of his clothes matched the environment.”

title: Sunset Stroll by Helen Ogbourn
text:
Sunset Stroll by Helen Ogbourn
“Walking on Penhors beach in Brittany, France, I noticed how the sun’s light stretched onto a small strip of sand for a few seconds each time a wave lapped the shore. I shot at a low angle to capture this.”

title: The Old Lifeboat House by William Razzell
text:
The Old Lifeboat House by William Razzell
“I have visited Newquay in the UK several times so when there was a rapidly passing storm in the evening I knew that this spot, overlooking the Fistral headland, would be great for when the clouds began to clear.”

title: Great Crested Grebe by Paul McMullen
text:
Great Crested Grebe by Paul McMullen
“I got to the lake very early and waited until the mist lifted to capture this great crested grebe just as I’d hoped, shooting low to the water.”

title: The Thatcher by Peter Delaney
text:
The Thatcher by Peter Delaney
“This was taken in the Giants Castle region of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. This woman’s husband had died the previous year, and she was cutting this thatch to repair the roof of her home.”

title: Hypnotising Eyes by Chris Frank
text:
Hypnotising Eyes by Chris Frank
“I took this in South Tyrol near Merano, Italy, where there is a wild bird refuge. They put on a bird show, which gave me the opportunity to take this shot as an owl from the refuge flew by.”
